snippet: Angelina Jolie’s decision to have her breasts removed because she carries a rare defective gene underscored the painful choices women face in trying to prevent breast cancer.
abstract: Actress Angelina Jolie's decision to have her breasts removed because she carries a rare defective gene underscores the painful choices women face in trying to prevent breast cancer; breast cancer experts and advocates applaud her decision and the manner in which she disclosed it, but some doctors worry that her disclosure will start a trend toward mastectomies that are not medically necessary for many early-stage breast cancers.

byline.original: By DENISE GRADY, TARA PARKER-POPE and PAM BELLUCK

lead_paragraph: Angelina Jolie’s decision to have her breasts removed because she carries a rare defective gene underscored the painful choices women face in trying to prevent breast cancer.

headline.seo: Angelina Jolie’s Disclosure Highlights a Breast Cancer Dilemma
headline.main: Jolie’s Disclosure of Preventive Mastectomy Highlights Dilemma
headline.print_headline: Jolie’s Disclosure of Preventive Mastectomy Highlights Dilemma
